db:abstract.db:para: Provides access to keyboard, mouse, and touch input.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.8.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The WaylandSeat type provides access to different types of user input and maintains a keyboard focus and a mouse pointer. It corresponds to the wl_seat interface in the Wayland protocol.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] void sendKeyEvent(int qtKey, bool pressed)
db:section.db:para: Sends a key press or release to the keyboard device.
This method was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: void sendTouchCancelEvent(WaylandClient client)
db:section.db:para: Sends a cancel event to the touch device of a client.

db:section.db:title: void sendTouchFrameEvent(WaylandClient client)
db:section.db:para: Sends a frame event to the touch device of a client to indicate the end of a series of touch up, down, and motion events.

db:section.db:title: void sendTouchPointMoved(WaylandSurface surface, int id, point position)
db:section.db:para: Sends a touch moved event for the touch point id on surface with position position.

db:note.db:para: You need to send a touch frame event when you are done sending touch events.

db:section.db:para: Returns the serial for the touch motion event.

db:section.db:title: uint sendTouchPointPressed(WaylandSurface surface, int id, point position)
db:section.db:para: Sends a touch pressed event for the touch point id on surface with position position.

db:note.db:para: You need to send a touch frame event when you are done sending touch events.

db:section.db:para: Returns the serial for the touch down event.

db:section.db:title: void sendTouchPointReleased(WaylandSurface surface, int id, point position)
db:section.db:para: Sends a touch released event for the touch point id on surface with position position.

db:note.db:para: You need to send a touch frame event when you are done sending touch events.

db:section.db:para: Returns the serial for the touch up event.
